title: Conversation: Carol Ross Barney on Architecture
title_display: Conversation: Carol Ross Barney on Architecture
hero_caption: Carol Ross Barney on the Chicago Riverwalk. Courtesy of AIA.
short_description: Join renowned Chicago architect and 2023 AIA Gold Medal recipient, Carol Ross Barney in conversation with Alison Fisher, Harold & Margot Schiff Curator of Architecture and Design, Jen Masengarb, Executive Director of AIA Chicago, and Eleanor Gorski,CEO & President of the Chicago Architecture Center for a discussion of her life and work.
list_description: Join renowned Chicago architect and 2023 AIA Gold Medal recipient, Carol Ross Barney in conversation with Alison Fisher, Harold & Margot Schiff Curator of Architecture and Design, Jen Masengarb, Executive Director of AIA Chicago, and Eleanor Gorski, CEO & President of the Chicago Architecture Center for a discussion of her life and work.
description:
Join renowned Chicago architect and 2023 AIA Gold Medal recipient Carol Ross Barney for a conversation on her life and work. Barney is joined by Alison Fisher, Harold and Margot Schiff Curator of Architecture and Design, Jen Masengarb, executive director of AIA Chicago, and Eleanor Gorski, CEO and president of the Chicago Architecture Center.

Presented in partnership with the Chicago chapter of The American Institute of Architects (AIA Chicago) and the Chicago Architecture Center (CAC) with additional support from Chicago Women in Architecture and the Art Institute’s Solomon Fund.

About the Speakers

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination. Anyone who would like to continue to wear a mask is welcome to do so. Learn more about our visiting policies and what to expect.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
